meanings.definition: A type of screwdriver with a flat, wide tip.
meanings.sent1: I used a flathead to tighten the screws on the table.
meanings.sent2: The flathead is perfect for fixing things around the house.
meanings.sent3: Why did the screwdriver go to school? To become a flathead!
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like a flathead, always getting the job done.
meanings.sent5: The shiny flathead gleamed in the toolbox, ready for action.

meanings.definition: A type of fish with a flat head.
meanings.sent1: The flathead fish swam gracefully in the clear water.
meanings.sent2: We caught a flathead during our fishing trip last summer.
meanings.sent3: Why did the fish blush? Because it saw a flathead swimming by!
meanings.sent4: The flathead fish moved stealthily, blending into the sandy ocean floor.
meanings.sent5: Children giggled as they watched the flathead fish glide through the aquarium.

meanings.definition: A type of nail with a flat head.
meanings.sent1: I hammered the flathead into the wooden board to secure it.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter always carries a box of flathead nails.
meanings.sent3: Why did the nail refuse to work? Because it wanted to be a flathead!
meanings.sent4: The flathead nail stood out among the other nails, easy to spot.
meanings.sent5: With a swift strike, the flathead nail was in place, holding the frame together.
